intro: Jambosa bataanensis, commonly known as the Bataan jambosa, is a rare species native to the Philippines. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Myrtaceae family, characterized by its evergreen foliage and fragrant blossoms. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
